timeline.bodyText: Should this maybe be like onSetRecipeBookOptions? (and the packet name too?)
timeline.author: Gegy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,3 +88,5 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_2792 net/minecraft/network/listener/ServerPlayPacketLi
 		ARG 1 packet
 	METHOD method_27273 onJigsawGenerating (Lnet/minecraft/class_5194;)V
 		ARG 1 packet
+	METHOD method_30303 onRecipeBookOption (Lnet/minecraft/class_5427;)V

replies.bodyText:
hmm, this packet sends the recipe book option for one recipe category (i.e. crafting, furnace, etc.)
imo the set part of the name you propose is extraneous.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Okay right, I see. I think it might still make sense to have this be plural though, because there are still multiple options per category. In the case of the set, this is mainly motivated because onRecipeBookOption reads a bit weirdly with no verb
replies.author: Gegy

replies.bodyText: So like RecipeCategoryOption then? it sends the option for like crafting, like two booleans of if the screen is open and if the filter craftable is on
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: That’d be better, but I think it still would have the problems I mentioned before without the set and without the plural. Probably rather get a third opinion on this :)
replies.author: Gegy

replies.bodyText: I still think the plural is better here. There are two options being set, gui open and filtering craftable. 2 options in 1 category is "category options".
replies.author: Earthcomputer
